result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10:50 AM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bias M Fields not in court. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Deft. does not appear.   BTC: Bond forf.  Warrant remains.

11:07 AM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Bias M Fields. Court reporter Linda Matoska.  Defense has no explanation for the non appearance.  BTC: Warrant remains, bond forfeiture hearing remains.
Return on warrant on July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:40 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Bias M Fields. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  Atty Preston spoke to the deft. yesterday.  The deft. believes he has covid.  Atty Preston informed the deft. that the court would need documentation.  This is the second time this deft. has claimed this. The deft. never filed any test results from April.  BTC:  No appearance by defendant, Arrest/Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond to be forfeited.  **STAYED UNTIL 8:30AM, JULY 6, 2022**

Court needs information on the resolution of the other cases.   Deft. tested positive this morning and is sending in the results.  Court admonishes the deft.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Erin Preston
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:44 PM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Bias M Fields appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Bias M Fields. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 17, 2022 at 08:45 am.
